sentences.text: Early President of Uzbekistan|presidential elections were held in Uzbekistan on 9 July 2023. The early election was called after the approval of the 2023 Uzbek constitutional referendum|constitutional referendum where term limits were reset and president Shavkat Mirziyoyev can serve two more seven-year terms.

references.text: <ref name=":0">{{Cite web |title=Uzbekistan's leader calls for snap presidential election in July |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/5/8/uzbekistans-leader-calls-for-snap-presidential-election-in-july |access-date=2023-05-08 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en}}</ref>
<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://en.trend.az/casia/uzbekistan/3745467.html|title=Uzbekistan announces early presidential election for July 9|date=May 8, 2023|website=Trend.Az}}</ref>

sentences.text: {{See also|2023 Uzbek constitutional referendum}}A constitutional referendum was held in Uzbekistan on 30 April 2023. It was held on proposed constitutional amendments.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |date=15 March 2023 |title=Uzbekistan announces constitutional reform referendum |language=en |work=Bloomberg |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/press-releases/2023-03-15/uzbekistan-announces-constitutional-reform-referendum |access-date=25 March 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=Final Draft of Constitutional Amendments Reportedly Ready in Uzbekistan |url=https://thediplomat.com/2023/03/final-draft-of-constitutional-amendments-reportedly-ready-in-uzbekistan/ |access-date=25 March 2023 |website=The Diplomat |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: Parliament of Uzbekistan|Parliament approved the referendum on 15 March 2023. The amendments were accepted in the referendum with over 90% in support, which will allow Mirziyoyev to be president for two further terms if re-elected.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Uzbekistan announces constitutional reform referendum |url=https://www.prnewswire.co.uk/news-releases/uzbekistan-announces-constitutional-reform-referendum-301771364.html |access-date=25 March 2023 |website=PR Newswire |language=en}}</ref>
<ref>{{Cite web |title=Референдумнинг дастлабки натижалари эълон қилинди |url=https://kun.uz/96089812 |website=Kun.uz}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=Uzbekistan votes 'yes' to new constitution in victory for president |url=https://asia.nikkei.com/Politics/Uzbekistan-votes-yes-to-new-constitution-in-victory-for-president |website=Nikkei Asia}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=ЦИК Узбекистана: Более 90% проголосовавших поддержали поправки в Конституцию |url=https://rus.ozodlik.org/a/32386877.html |access-date=1 May 2023 |website=Радио Озодлик |date=May 2023 |language=ru}}</ref>

sentences.text: The Uzbekistan legislation requires at least 33% of eligible voters to take part in the presidential elections, otherwise, the elections will be pronounced invalid. The law also provides for a second round if none of the candidates receives more than 50% of the vote. In practice, neither of these events have yet occurred, as every presidential election winner since the country's independence in 1991 has won with over 80% of the vote on a turnout of over 79%, and each incumbent standing for re-election has been re-elected.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-06-27 |title=Elections in Uzbekistan: 2023 Presidential Elections |url=https://www.ifes.org/tools-resources/election-snapshots/elections-uzbekistan-2023-presidential-elections |access-date=2023-09-05 |website=International Foundation for Electoral Systems |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: The Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) said that the elected "lacked genuine political competition despite some efforts to reform." Their report mentioned "indications of ballot box stuffing as well as numerous observations of seemingly identical signatures on the voter lists," noting that "None of the registered candidates publicly criticized the current president or presented alternative political views and the campaign remained low key throughout, with observers noting that events often appeared orchestrated." The mission did, however, highly appreciate preparations for presidential elections.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.osce.org/odihr/elections/uzbekistan/548191|title=Uzbekistan's presidential election lacked genuine political competition despite some efforts to reform, international observers say|website=Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=July 12, 2023 |title=OSCE/ODIHR Mission Highly Appreciated Preparations for Presidential Elections in Uzbekistan |url=https://fox56news.com/business/press-releases/ein-presswire/644179958/osce-odihr-mission-highly-appreciated-preparations-for-presidential-elections-in-uzbekistan/ |access-date=2023-07-15 |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: Uzbekistan’s President Shavkat Mirziyoyev was re-elected with 88% of the vote. The preliminary results of the presidential elections were announced at a briefing by the chairman of the Central Election Commission of Uzbekistan, Zainiddin Nizamkhojaev. More than 15 million voters participated in elections.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-10 |title=Shavkat Mirziyoyev re-elected President of Uzbekistan |url=https://www.azernews.az/region/212092.html |access-date=2023-07-10 |website=Azernews.Az |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text:
* {{flagcountry|KAZ}}: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev of Kazakhstan was the first to congratulate his colleague on the victory. President Tokayev described the results of the presidential election as proof of people’s support of the current Uzbek president’s political course aimed at ensuring the sustainable growth, stability and prosperity of Uzbekistan, the president’s press service said.
* {{Flagcountry|RUS}}: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday congratulated Mirziyoyev in a message published on the Kremlin website. "This convincing electoral victory confirms your high political authority and points to the broad, popular support for your policy of large-scale reforms," Putin said.
*{{Flagcountry|CHN}}: President and General Secretary of the Communist Party Xi Jinping also offered congratulations as well as praise for Mirziyoyev's leadership. "I am willing to work with you to promote the continuous development of the China-Uzbekistan comprehensive strategic partnership and inject new impetus into the construction of a China-Uzbekistan community with a shared future".<ref name=":1" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://kz.kursiv.media/en/2023-07-10/uzbekistan-finalizes-results-of-presidential-elections/|title=Uzbekistan finalizes results of presidential elections|first=Olesya|last=Bassarova|date=July 10, 2023|website=Kursiv Media Kazakhstan}}</ref>

<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |title=Uzbekistan's leader reelected with 87% of the vote |work=Deutsche Welle|DW |url=https://www.dw.com/en/uzbekistans-leader-reelected-with-87-of-the-vote/a-66173442}}</ref>
